00126 #define NB_OPT_TOK 10
00127 #define NB_TOK_PATH 20

00148 uint64_t nfs4_PseudoToId( nfs_fh4 * fh4p )
00149 {
00150   file_handle_v4_t * pfhandle4;
00151   uint64_t out = 0LL ;
00152   
00153   pfhandle4 = (file_handle_v4_t *)(fh4p->nfs_fh4_val) ;
00154 
00155   out = (uint64_t) (pfhandle4->pseudofs_id)  ;
00156   return out ;
00157 } /* nfs4_PseudoToId */

00173 
00183 int nfs4_ExportToPseudoFS( exportlist_t * pexportlist )
00184 {
00185         exportlist_t      * entry ;
00186   exportlist_t      * next;     /* exportlist entry   */
00187         int                 i = 0 ;
00188   int                 j = 0 ;
00189   int                 found = 0 ;
00190   char                tmp_pseudopath[MAXPATHLEN] ;
00191   char              * PathTok[NB_TOK_PATH] ;
00192   int                 NbTokPath ;
00193   pseudofs_t        * PseudoFs = NULL ;
00194   pseudofs_entry_t  * PseudoFsRoot = NULL ;
00195   pseudofs_entry_t  * PseudoFsCurrent = NULL ;
00196   pseudofs_entry_t  * newPseudoFsEntry = NULL ;
00197   pseudofs_entry_t  * iterPseudoFs = NULL ;
00198 
00199         entry = pexportlist ;
00200   
00201   PseudoFs = &gPseudoFs ;
00202   
00203   
00204   /* Init Root of the Pseudo FS tree */
00205   strncpy( PseudoFs->root.name, "/", MAXNAMLEN ) ;
00206   strncpy( PseudoFs->root.fullname, "(nfsv4root)", MAXPATHLEN ) ;
00207   PseudoFs->root.pseudo_id = 0 ;
00208   PseudoFs->root.junction_export = NULL ;
00209   PseudoFs->root.next = NULL ;
00210   PseudoFs->root.last = PseudoFsRoot ;
00211   PseudoFs->root.sons = NULL ;
00212   PseudoFs->root.parent = &(PseudoFs->root) ; /* root is its own parent */
00213   
00214   /* Allocation of the parsing table */
00215   for( i = 0 ; i < NB_TOK_PATH ; i++ )
00216     if( (PathTok[i] = (char *)Mem_Alloc(MAXNAMLEN)) == NULL )
00217       return ENOMEM ;
00218   
00219         while (entry)
00220     {
00221       /* To not forget to init "/" entry */
00222       PseudoFsCurrent = &(PseudoFs->root) ;
00223       PseudoFs->reverse_tab[0] = &(PseudoFs->root) ;
00224       
00225       if( entry->options & EXPORT_OPTION_PSEUDO )
00226         {
00227           DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "BUILDING PSEUDOFS: Id          = %d", entry->id);
00228           DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "BUILDING PSEUDOFS: ANON        = %d", entry->anonymous_uid);
00229           DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "BUILDING PSEUDOFS: Path        = %s", entry->fullpath);
00230           DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "BUILDING PSEUDOFS: Options     = 0x%x", entry->options);
00231           DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "BUILDING PSEUDOFS: Num Clients = %d", entry->clients.num_clients);
00232           
00233           /* A pseudo path is to ne managed */
00234           DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "BUILDING PSEUDOFS: Now managing %s seen as %s",
00235                            entry->fullpath, entry->pseudopath ) ;
00236           
00237           /* Parsing the path */
00238           strncpy( tmp_pseudopath, entry->pseudopath, MAXPATHLEN ) ;
00239           if( ( NbTokPath = nfs_ParseConfLine( PathTok, NB_TOK_PATH, tmp_pseudopath, find_slash, find_endLine ) ) < 0 )
00240             {
00241               /* Path is badly formed */
00242               DisplayLog( "BUILDING PSEUDOFS: Invalid 'pseudo' option: %s", entry->pseudopath ) ;
00243               continue ;
00244             }
00245           
00246           /* there must be a leading '/' in the pseudo path */
00247           if( entry->pseudopath[0] != '/' )
00248             {
00249               /* Path is badly formed */
00250               DisplayLog( "Pseudo Path '%s' is badly formed", entry->pseudopath ) ;
00251               continue ;
00252             }
00253           
00254           /* Loop on each token. Because first character in pseudo path is '/'
00255            * we can avoid looking at PathTok[0] which is necessary '\0'. That's 
00256            * the reason why we start looping at pos = 1 */
00257 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFS_V4
00258           for( j = 1 ; j < NbTokPath ; j++ )
00259             printf( "     tokens are #%s#\n", PathTok[j] ) ;
00260 #endif
00261 
00262           for( j = 1 ; j < NbTokPath ; j++ )
00263             {
00264               found = 0 ;
00265               for( iterPseudoFs = PseudoFsCurrent->sons ; iterPseudoFs !=  NULL ; iterPseudoFs = iterPseudoFs->next )
00266                 {
00267                   /* Looking for a matching entry */
00268                   if( !strcmp( iterPseudoFs->name, PathTok[j] ) )
00269                     {
00270                       found = 1 ;
00271                       break ;
00272                     }
00273                 } /* for iterPseudoFs */
00274               
00275               if( found )
00276                 {
00277                   /* a matching entry was found in the tree */
00278                   PseudoFsCurrent = iterPseudoFs ;
00279                 }
00280               else
00281                 {
00282                   /* a new entry is to be created */
00283                   if( ( newPseudoFsEntry = (pseudofs_entry_t *)Mem_Alloc( sizeof( pseudofs_entry_t ) ) ) == NULL )
00284                     return ENOMEM ;
00285                   
00286                   /* Creating the new entry, allocate an id for it and add it to reverse tab */
00287                   strncpy( newPseudoFsEntry->name, PathTok[j], MAXNAMLEN ) ;
00288                   newPseudoFsEntry->pseudo_id = PseudoFs->last_pseudo_id + 1 ;
00289                   PseudoFs->last_pseudo_id = newPseudoFsEntry->pseudo_id ;
00290                   PseudoFs->reverse_tab[PseudoFs->last_pseudo_id] = newPseudoFsEntry ;
00291                   newPseudoFsEntry->junction_export = NULL ;
00292                   newPseudoFsEntry->last   = newPseudoFsEntry;
00293                   newPseudoFsEntry->next   = NULL ;
00294                   newPseudoFsEntry->sons   = NULL ;
00295                   snprintf( newPseudoFsEntry->fullname, MAXPATHLEN, "%s/%s", PseudoFsCurrent->fullname,  PathTok[j] ) ;
00296 
00297                   /* Step into the new entry and attach it to the tree */
00298                   if( PseudoFsCurrent->sons == NULL )
00299                     PseudoFsCurrent->sons = newPseudoFsEntry ;
00300                   else
00301                     {
00302                       PseudoFsCurrent->sons->last->next = newPseudoFsEntry ;
00303                       PseudoFsCurrent->sons->last = newPseudoFsEntry ;
00304                     }
00305                   newPseudoFsEntry->parent = PseudoFsCurrent ;
00306                   PseudoFsCurrent = newPseudoFsEntry ;
00307                 }
00308               
00309             } /* for j */
00310 
00311           /* Now that all entries are added to pseudofs tree, add the junction to the pseudofs */
00312           PseudoFsCurrent->junction_export = entry ;
00313           
00314         } /* if( entry->options & EXPORT_OPTION_PSEUDO ) */
00315       
00316       next = entry->next;
00317       
00318       entry = next;
00319     } /* while( entry ) */
00320   
00321   
00322   /* desalocation of the parsing table */
00323   for( i = 0 ; i < NB_TOK_PATH ; i++ )
00324     Mem_Free(PathTok[i] ) ;
00325   
00326         return (0);
00327 }
00328 
00344 int nfs4_PseudoToFattr( pseudofs_entry_t * psfsp, 
00345                         fattr4           * Fattr ,
00346                         compound_data_t  * data,
00347                         nfs_fh4          * objFH,
00348                         bitmap4          * Bitmap)
00349 {
00350   fattr4_type               file_type ;
00351   fattr4_link_support       link_support ;
00352   fattr4_symlink_support    symlink_support ;
00353   fattr4_fh_expire_type     expire_type ;
00354   fattr4_named_attr         named_attr ;
00355   fattr4_unique_handles     unique_handles ;
00356   fattr4_archive            archive ;
00357   fattr4_cansettime         cansettime ;
00358   fattr4_case_insensitive   case_insensitive ;
00359   fattr4_case_preserving    case_preserving ;
00360   fattr4_chown_restricted   chown_restricted ;
00361   fattr4_hidden             hidden ;
00362   fattr4_mode               file_mode ;
00363   fattr4_no_trunc           no_trunc ;
00364   fattr4_numlinks           file_numlinks ;
00365   fattr4_rawdev             rawdev ;
00366   fattr4_system             system ;
00367   fattr4_size               file_size ;
00368   fattr4_space_used         file_space_used ;
00369   fattr4_fsid               fsid ;
00370   fattr4_time_access        time_access ;
00371   fattr4_time_modify        time_modify ;
00372   fattr4_time_metadata      time_metadata ;
00373   fattr4_time_delta         time_delta ;
00374   fattr4_time_backup        time_backup ;
00375   fattr4_time_create        time_create ;
00376   fattr4_change             file_change ;
00377   fattr4_fileid             file_id ;
00378   fattr4_owner              file_owner ;
00379   fattr4_owner_group        file_owner_group ;
00380   fattr4_space_avail        space_avail ;
00381   fattr4_space_free         space_free ;
00382   fattr4_space_total        space_total ;
00383   fattr4_files_avail        files_avail ;
00384   fattr4_files_free         files_free ;
00385   fattr4_files_total        files_total ;
00386   fattr4_lease_time         lease_time ;
00387   fattr4_maxfilesize        max_filesize ;
00388   fattr4_supported_attrs    supported_attrs ;
00389   fattr4_maxread            maxread ;
00390   fattr4_maxwrite           maxwrite ;
00391   fattr4_maxname            maxname ;
00392   fattr4_maxlink            maxlink ;
00393   fattr4_homogeneous        homogeneous ;
00394   fattr4_acl                acl ;
00395   fattr4_mimetype           mimetype ;
00396   fattr4_aclsupport         aclsupport ;
00397   fattr4_fs_locations       fs_locations ;
00398   fattr4_quota_avail_hard   quota_avail_hard ;
00399   fattr4_quota_avail_soft   quota_avail_soft ;
00400   fattr4_quota_used         quota_used ;
00401   fattr4_mounted_on_fileid  mounted_on_fileid ;
00402 
00403   u_int        fhandle_len = 0 ;
00404   uint32_t     supported_attrs_len = 0 ;
00405   uint32_t     supported_attrs_val = 0 ;
00406   unsigned int LastOffset ;
00407   unsigned int len = 0 , off = 0 ; /* Use for XDR alignment */
00408   int          op_attr_success = 0 ;
00409   unsigned int c           = 0 ;
00410   unsigned int i           = 0 ;
00411   unsigned int j           = 0 ;
00412   unsigned int k           = 0 ;
00413   unsigned int attrmasklen = 0 ;
00414   unsigned int attribute_to_set = 0 ; 
00415 
00416   unsigned int attrvalslist_supported[FATTR4_MOUNTED_ON_FILEID] ;
00417   unsigned int attrmasklist[FATTR4_MOUNTED_ON_FILEID] ; /* List cannot be longer than FATTR4_MOUNTED_ON_FILEID */ 
00418   unsigned int attrvalslist[FATTR4_MOUNTED_ON_FILEID] ; /* List cannot be longer than FATTR4_MOUNTED_ON_FILEID */
00419   char     attrvalsBuffer[ ATTRVALS_BUFFLEN] ;
00420  
00421   char     __attribute__(( __unused__ )) funcname[] = "nfs4_PseudoToFattr" ;
00422   
00423 
00424   /* memset to make sure the arrays are initiated to 0 */
00425   memset( attrvalsBuffer, 0, NFS4_ATTRVALS_BUFFLEN ) ;
00426   memset( &attrmasklist, 0, FATTR4_MOUNTED_ON_FILEID * sizeof( unsigned int ) ) ;
00427   memset( &attrvalslist, 0, FATTR4_MOUNTED_ON_FILEID * sizeof( unsigned int ) ) ;
00428 
00429   /* Convert the attribute bitmap to an attribute list */
00430   nfs4_bitmap4_to_list( Bitmap, &attrmasklen, attrmasklist ) ;
00431   
00432   /* Once the bitmap has been converted to a list of attribute, manage each attribute */
00433   Fattr->attr_vals.attrlist4_len = 0 ;
00434   LastOffset  = 0 ; 
00435   j=0 ;
00436 
00437 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00438   DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, 
00439                    "Asked Attributes (Pseudo): Bitmap = (len=%d, val[0]=%d, val[1]=%d), %d item in list", 
00440                    Bitmap->bitmap4_len, Bitmap->bitmap4_val[0], Bitmap->bitmap4_val[1],  attrmasklen ) ;
00441 #endif
00442 
00443  
00444  for( i = 0 ; i < attrmasklen ; i++ )
00445     {
00446       attribute_to_set = attrmasklist[i] ;
00447       
00448       DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs,
00449                         NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "Flag for Operation (Pseudo) = %d|%d is ON,  name  = %s  reply_size = %d", 
00450                        attrmasklist[i], 
00451                        fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].val, 
00452                        fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].name, 
00453                        fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ) ;
00454 
00455       op_attr_success = 0 ;
00456       
00457       /* compute the new size for the fattr4 reply */
00458       /* This space is to be filled below in the big switch/case statement */
00459 
00460       switch( attribute_to_set )
00461         {
00462         case FATTR4_SUPPORTED_ATTRS:
00463 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00464           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_SUPPORTED_ATTRS\n" ) ;
00465 #endif            
00466           /* The supported attributes have field ',supported' set in tab fattr4tab, I will proceed in 2 pass 
00467            * 1st: compute the number of supported attributes
00468            * 2nd: allocate the replyed bitmap and fill it
00469            *
00470            * I do not set a #define to keep the number of supported attributes because I want this parameter
00471            * to be a consequence of fattr4tab and avoid incoherency */
00472           
00473           /* How many supported attributes ? Compute the result in variable named c and set attrvalslist_supported  */
00474           c = 0 ;
00475           for( k = FATTR4_SUPPORTED_ATTRS ; k <= FATTR4_MOUNTED_ON_FILEID ; k++ )
00476             {
00477               if( fattr4tab[k].supported )
00478                 {
00479                   attrvalslist_supported[c++] = k ;
00480                 }
00481             }
00482           
00483           /* Let set the reply bitmap */
00485           if( ( supported_attrs.bitmap4_val = (uint32_t *)Mem_Alloc( 2*sizeof( uint32_t ) ) ) == NULL )
00486             return -1 ; 
00487           memset( supported_attrs.bitmap4_val, 0, 2*sizeof( uint32_t ) ) ;
00488           nfs4_list_to_bitmap4( &supported_attrs, &c, attrvalslist_supported ) ;
00489 
00490 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO          
00491           DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "Fattr (pseudo) supported_attrs(len)=%u -> %u|%u", 
00492                            supported_attrs.bitmap4_len, supported_attrs.bitmap4_val[0],
00493                            supported_attrs.bitmap4_val[1] ) ;
00494 #endif
00495           
00496 
00497           /* This kind of operation is always a success */
00498           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00499 
00500           /* we store the index */
00501           supported_attrs_len = htonl( supported_attrs.bitmap4_len ) ;
00502           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &supported_attrs_len, sizeof( uint32_t ) ) ; 
00503           LastOffset += sizeof( uint32_t ) ;   
00504 
00505           /* And then the data */
00506           for( k = 0 ; k <  supported_attrs.bitmap4_len ; k++ )
00507             {
00508               supported_attrs_val = htonl( supported_attrs.bitmap4_val[k] ) ;
00509               memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &supported_attrs_val, sizeof( uint32_t ) ) ;
00510               LastOffset += sizeof( uint32_t ) ;
00511             }
00512           break ;
00513               
00514         case FATTR4_TYPE:
00515 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00516           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_TYPE\n" ) ;
00517 #endif
00518           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00519           file_type = htonl( NF4DIR ) ; /* There are only directories in the pseudo fs */
00520 
00521           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &file_type, sizeof( fattr4_type ) ) ;
00522           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00523           break ;
00524               
00525         case FATTR4_FH_EXPIRE_TYPE:
00526 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00527           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_FH_EXPIRE_TYPE\n" ) ;
00528 #endif
00529           /* For the moment, we handle only the persistent filehandle */
00530           expire_type = htonl( FH4_VOLATILE_ANY ) ;
00531           /* expire_type = htonl( FH4_PERSISTENT ) ; */
00532           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &expire_type, sizeof( expire_type ) ) ;
00533           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00534           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00535           break ;
00536               
00537         case FATTR4_CHANGE:
00538 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00539           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_CHANGE\n" ) ;
00540 #endif
00541           /* Use boot time as time value for every pseudo fs object */
00542           memset( &file_change, 0, sizeof( changeid4 ) ) ;
00543           file_change = nfs_htonl64(  (changeid4)ServerBootTime ) ;
00544 
00545           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &file_change, sizeof(  fattr4_change ) ) ;
00546           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00547           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00548           break ;
00549               
00550         case FATTR4_SIZE:
00551 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00552           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_SIZE\n" ) ;
00553 #endif
00554           file_size = nfs_htonl64( (fattr4_size)DEV_BSIZE );       
00555           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &file_size, sizeof(  fattr4_size ) ) ;
00556           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00557           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00558           break ;
00559               
00560         case FATTR4_LINK_SUPPORT:
00561 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00562           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_LINK_SUPPORT\n" ) ;
00563 #endif
00564           /* HPSS NameSpace support hard link */
00565           link_support = htonl( TRUE );
00566           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &link_support, sizeof( fattr4_link_support )) ; 
00567           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00568           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00569           break ;
00570               
00571         case FATTR4_SYMLINK_SUPPORT:
00572 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00573           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_SYMLINK_SUPPORT\n" ) ;
00574 #endif
00575           /* HPSS NameSpace support symbolic link */
00576           symlink_support = htonl( TRUE ) ;
00577           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &symlink_support, sizeof( fattr4_symlink_support )) ; 
00578           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00579           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00580           break ;
00581               
00582         case FATTR4_NAMED_ATTR:
00583 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00584           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_NAMED_ATTR\n" ) ;
00585 #endif
00586           /* For this version of the binary, named attributes is not supported */
00587           named_attr = htonl( FALSE ) ;
00588           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &named_attr, sizeof( fattr4_named_attr )) ;
00589           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00590           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00591           break ;
00592               
00593         case FATTR4_FSID:
00594 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00595           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_FSID\n" ) ;
00596 #endif
00597           /* The file system id (should be unique per fileset according to the HPSS logic) */
00598           if( psfsp->junction_export == NULL )
00599             {
00600               fsid.major = nfs_htonl64( 152LL ) ;
00601               fsid.minor = nfs_htonl64( 152LL ) ;
00602             }
00603           else
00604             {
00605               fsid.major = nfs_htonl64( 153LL ) ; /* @todo BUGAZOMEU : tres cradem mais utile */
00606               fsid.minor = nfs_htonl64( 153LL ) ;
00607             }
00608           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &fsid, sizeof( fattr4_fsid) ) ;
00609           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00610           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00611           break ;
00612               
00613         case FATTR4_UNIQUE_HANDLES:
00614 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00615           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_UNIQUE_HANDLES\n" ) ;
00616 #endif
00617           /* Filehandles are unique */ 
00618           unique_handles = htonl( TRUE );
00619           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &unique_handles, sizeof( fattr4_unique_handles) ) ;
00620           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00621           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00622           break ;
00623               
00624         case FATTR4_LEASE_TIME:
00625 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00626           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_LEASE_TIME\n" ) ;
00627 #endif
00628           lease_time = htonl( NFS4_LEASE_LIFETIME ) ;
00629           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &lease_time, sizeof( fattr4_lease_time ) ) ;
00630           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00631           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00632           break ;
00633               
00634         case FATTR4_RDATTR_ERROR:
00635 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00636           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_RDATTR_ERROR\n" ) ;
00637 #endif
00638           op_attr_success = htonl( 0 ) ; /* not used in a getattr call */
00639           break ;
00640               
00641         case FATTR4_ACL:
00642 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00643           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_ACL\n" ) ;
00644 #endif
00645           acl.fattr4_acl_len = htonl( 0 ) ;
00646           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &acl, sizeof( fattr4_acl ) ) ;
00647           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00648           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00649           break ;
00650               
00651         case FATTR4_ACLSUPPORT:
00652 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00653           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_ACL_SUPPORT\n" ) ;
00654 #endif
00655           aclsupport = htonl( ACL4_SUPPORT_DENY_ACL ) ; /* temporary, wanting for houston to give me information to implemente ACL's support */
00656           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &aclsupport, sizeof( fattr4_aclsupport ) ) ;
00657           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00658           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00659           break ;
00660               
00661         case FATTR4_ARCHIVE:
00662 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00663           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_ARCHIVE\n" ) ;
00664 #endif
00665           /* Archive flag is not supported */
00666           archive = htonl( FALSE ) ;
00667           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &archive,sizeof( fattr4_archive ) ); 
00668           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00669           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00670           break ;
00671               
00672         case FATTR4_CANSETTIME:
00673 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00674           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_CANSETTIME\n" ) ;
00675 #endif
00676           /* The time can be set on files */
00677           cansettime = htonl( TRUE );
00678           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &cansettime, sizeof( fattr4_cansettime ) ) ;
00679           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00680           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00681           break ;
00682               
00683         case FATTR4_CASE_INSENSITIVE:
00684 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00685           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_CASE_INSENSITIVE\n" ) ;
00686 #endif
00687           /* pseudofs is not case INSENSITIVE... it is Read-Only */
00688           case_insensitive = htonl( FALSE );
00689           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset),  &case_insensitive, sizeof( fattr4_case_insensitive ) ) ;
00690           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00691           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00692           break ;
00693               
00694         case FATTR4_CASE_PRESERVING:
00695 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00696           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_PRESERVING\n" ) ;
00697 #endif
00698           /* pseudofs is case preserving... it is Read-Only */
00699           case_preserving = htonl( TRUE ) ;
00700           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset),  &case_preserving, sizeof( fattr4_case_preserving ) );
00701           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00702           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00703           break ;
00704               
00705         case FATTR4_CHOWN_RESTRICTED :
00706 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00707           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_CHOWN_RESTRICTED\n" ) ;
00708 #endif
00709           /* chown is restricted to root, but in fact no chown will be done on pseudofs */
00710           chown_restricted = htonl( TRUE ) ;
00711           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset),  &chown_restricted, sizeof( fattr4_chown_restricted ) ) ; 
00712           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00713           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00714           break ;
00715               
00716         case FATTR4_FILEHANDLE:
00717 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00718           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_FILEHANDLE\n" ) ;
00719 #endif
00720           /* Return the file handle */
00721           fhandle_len = htonl( objFH->nfs_fh4_len ) ;
00722 
00723           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset),  
00724                   &fhandle_len, 
00725                   sizeof( u_int ) ) ; 
00726           LastOffset += sizeof( u_int ) ;
00727 
00728           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), 
00729                   objFH->nfs_fh4_val, 
00730                   objFH->nfs_fh4_len );
00731           LastOffset +=  objFH->nfs_fh4_len ;
00732           
00733           /* XDR's special stuff for 32-bit alignment */
00734           len = objFH->nfs_fh4_len ;
00735           off = 0 ;
00736           while( ( len + off ) %4 != 0 )
00737             {
00738               char c = '\0' ;
00739               
00740               off += 1 ;
00741               memset( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), c, 1 );
00742               LastOffset += 1 ;
00743             }
00744           
00745           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00746           break ;
00747               
00748         case FATTR4_FILEID:
00749 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00750           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_FILEID\n" ) ;
00751 #endif
00752           /* The analog to the inode number. RFC3530 says "a number uniquely identifying the file within the filesystem" 
00753            * In the case of a pseudofs entry, the entry's unique id is used */
00754           file_id =  nfs_htonl64( (fattr4_fileid)psfsp->pseudo_id ) ;
00755           
00756           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset),  &file_id, sizeof( fattr4_fileid ) ) ; 
00757           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00758           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00759           break ;
00760               
00761         case FATTR4_FILES_AVAIL :
00762 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00763           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_FILES_AVAIL\n" ) ;
00764 #endif
00765           files_avail =  nfs_htonl64( (fattr4_files_avail)512 ); /* Fake value */
00766           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &files_avail, sizeof( fattr4_files_avail ) ) ;
00767           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00768           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00769           break ;
00770               
00771         case FATTR4_FILES_FREE  :
00772 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00773           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_FILES_FREE\n" ) ;
00774 #endif
00775           files_free = nfs_htonl64( (fattr4_files_avail)512 ) ;  /* Fake value */
00776           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &files_free, sizeof( fattr4_files_free ) ) ;
00777           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00778           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00779           break ;
00780               
00781         case FATTR4_FILES_TOTAL :

00784 #endif
00785           files_total = nfs_htonl64( (fattr4_files_avail)512 )  ; /* Fake value */

00787           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;

00789           break ;
00790           
00791  
00792        case FATTR4_FS_LOCATIONS:

00795 #endif
00796           fs_locations.fs_root.pathname4_len = 0 ;
00797           fs_locations.locations.locations_len = 0 ; /* No FS_LOCATIONS no now */
00798           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00799           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00800           break ;
00801 
00802               
00803         case FATTR4_HIDDEN :
00804 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00805           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_HIDDEN\n" ) ;
00806 #endif
00807           /* There are no hidden file in pseudofs */
00808           hidden = htonl( FALSE );
00809           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset),  &hidden, sizeof( fattr4_hidden ) );
00810           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00811           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00812           break ;
00813               
00814         case FATTR4_HOMOGENEOUS:
00815 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00816           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_HOMOGENEOUS\n" ) ;
00817 #endif
00818           /* Unix semantic is homogeneous (all objects have the same kind of attributes) */
00819           homogeneous = htonl( TRUE ) ;
00820           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset),  &homogeneous, sizeof( fattr4_homogeneous ) );
00821           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00822           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00823           break ;
00824               
00825         case FATTR4_MAXFILESIZE :
00826 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00827           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_MAXFILESIZE\n" ) ;
00828 #endif
00829           max_filesize = nfs_htonl64( (fattr4_maxfilesize)FSINFO_MAX_FILESIZE );
00830           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset),  &max_filesize, sizeof( fattr4_maxfilesize ) );
00831           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00832           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00833           break ;
00834               
00835         case FATTR4_MAXLINK:
00836 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00837           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_MAXLINK\n" ) ;
00838 #endif
00839           maxlink = htonl( MAX_HARD_LINK_VALUE );
00840           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset),  &maxlink, sizeof( fattr4_maxlink ) );
00841           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00842           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00843           break ;
00844

00846 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00847           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_MAXNAME\n" ) ;

00850           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset),  &maxname, sizeof( fattr4_maxname ) );
00851           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00852           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00853           break ;

00858 #endif

00860           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset),  &maxread, sizeof( fattr4_maxread ) );
00861           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00862           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00863           break ;
00864               
00865         case  FATTR4_MAXWRITE:

00873           break ;
00874               
00875         case FATTR4_MIMETYPE :
00876 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO

00878 #endif
00879           mimetype.utf8string_len = htonl( 0 ) ;
00880           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset),  &mimetype, sizeof( fattr4_mimetype )) ;
00881           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00882           op_attr_success = 1 ; /* No supported for the moment */
00883           break ;
00884 
00885         case FATTR4_MODE :
00886 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00887           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_MODE\n" ) ;
00888 #endif
00889           file_mode = htonl( 0555 ); /* Every pseudo fs object is dr-xr-xr-x */ 
00890           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset),  &file_mode, sizeof( fattr4_mode )) ;              
00891           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00892           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00893           break ;
00894               
00895         case  FATTR4_NO_TRUNC:
00896 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00897           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_NO_TRUNC\n" ) ;
00898 #endif
00899           /* File's names are not truncated, an error is returned is name is too long */
00900           no_trunc = htonl( TRUE );
00901           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset),  &no_trunc, sizeof( fattr4_no_trunc ) ) ;
00902           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00903           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00904           break ;
00905               
00906         case  FATTR4_NUMLINKS:
00907 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00908           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_NUMLINKS\n" ) ;
00909 #endif
00910           /* Reply the number of links found in vattr structure */
00911           file_numlinks = htonl( (fattr4_numlinks)1 );
00912           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &file_numlinks, sizeof( fattr4_numlinks ) ) ;
00913           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
00914           op_attr_success = 1 ;
00915           break ;
00916               
00917         case  FATTR4_OWNER:
00918 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00919           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_OWNER\n" ) ;
00920 #endif
00921           /* Return the uid as a human readable utf8 string */
00922           if( uid2utf8( NFS4_ROOT_UID, &file_owner ) == 0 )
00923             {
00924              u_int utf8len = 0 ;
00925              u_int deltalen = 0 ;
00926 
00927              /* Take care of 32 bits alignment */
00928              if( file_owner.utf8string_len % 4 == 0 )
00929                 deltalen = 0 ;
00930              else
00931                 deltalen = 4 - file_owner.utf8string_len%4  ;
00932 
00933               utf8len = htonl( file_owner.utf8string_len + deltalen ) ; 
00934               memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), 
00935                       &utf8len, 
00936                       sizeof( u_int ) ) ;
00937               LastOffset += sizeof( u_int ) ;
00938                   
00939               memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), 
00940                       file_owner.utf8string_val, 
00941                       file_owner.utf8string_len ) ;
00942               LastOffset += file_owner.utf8string_len ;
00943 
00944               /* Free what was allocated by uid2utf8 */
00945               Mem_Free( (char *)file_owner.utf8string_val ) ;
00946 
00947                /* Pad with zero to keep xdr alignement */
00948               if( deltalen != 0 )
00949                 memset( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), 0, deltalen ) ;
00950               LastOffset += deltalen ;
00951 
00952               op_attr_success = 1 ;
00953             }
00954           else
00955             op_attr_success = 0 ;
00956           break ;
00957               
00958         case  FATTR4_OWNER_GROUP :
00959 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
00960           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_OWNER_GROUP\n" ) ;
00961 #endif
00962           /* Return the uid as a human readable utf8 string */
00963           if( gid2utf8( 2, &file_owner_group ) == 0 )
00964             {
00965              u_int utf8len = 0 ;
00966              u_int deltalen = 0 ;
00967 
00968               /* Take care of 32 bits alignment */
00969               if( file_owner_group.utf8string_len % 4 == 0 )
00970                  deltalen = 0 ;
00971               else
00972                  deltalen = 4 - file_owner_group.utf8string_len%4  ;
00973 
00974               utf8len = htonl( file_owner_group.utf8string_len + deltalen ) ;
00975               memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), 
00976                       &utf8len, 
00977                       sizeof( u_int ) ) ;
00978               LastOffset += sizeof( u_int ) ;
00979                   
00980               memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), 
00981                       file_owner_group.utf8string_val, 
00982                       file_owner_group.utf8string_len ) ;
00983               LastOffset += file_owner_group.utf8string_len ;
00984 
00985               /* Free what was used for utf8 conversion */
00986               Mem_Free( (char *)file_owner_group.utf8string_val ) ;
00987 
00988               /* Pad with zero to keep xdr alignement */
00989               if( deltalen != 0 )
00990                 memset( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), 0, deltalen ) ;
00991               LastOffset += deltalen ;
00992 
00993               op_attr_success = 1 ;
00994             }
00995           else
00996             op_attr_success = 0 ;
00997           break ;
00998 
00999         case  FATTR4_QUOTA_AVAIL_HARD:
01000 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
01001           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_QUOTA_AVAIL_HARD\n" ) ;
01002 #endif
01003           quota_avail_hard =  nfs_htonl64( (fattr4_quota_avail_hard)NFS_V4_MAX_QUOTA_HARD ) ; 
01004           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset),  &quota_avail_hard, sizeof( fattr4_quota_avail_hard ) );
01005           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
01006           op_attr_success = 1 ;
01007           break ;
01008 
01009         case FATTR4_QUOTA_AVAIL_SOFT :
01010 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
01011           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_QUOTA_AVAIL_SOFT\n" ) ;
01012 #endif
01013           quota_avail_soft =  nfs_htonl64( (fattr4_quota_avail_soft)NFS_V4_MAX_QUOTA_SOFT ) ; 
01014           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset),  &quota_avail_soft, sizeof( fattr4_quota_avail_soft ) );
01015           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
01016           op_attr_success = 1 ;
01017           break ;
01018 
01019         case  FATTR4_QUOTA_USED:
01020 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO

01032 #endif
01033           /* Not usefull, there are no special block or character file in HPSS */
01034           /* since FATTR4_TYPE will never be NFS4BLK or NFS4CHR, this value should not be used by the client */
01035           rawdev.specdata1 = htonl( 0 );

01045 #endif
