01047           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &space_avail, sizeof( fattr4_space_avail ) ) ;
01048           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
01049           op_attr_success = 1 ;
01050           break ;
01051           
01052         case FATTR4_SPACE_FREE :
01053 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
01054           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_SPACE_FREE\n" ) ;
01055 #endif
01056           space_free = nfs_htonl64( 512000LL ); /* Fake value */
01057           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &space_free, sizeof( fattr4_space_free ) ) ;
01058           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
01059           op_attr_success = 1 ;
01060           break ;
01061               
01062         case FATTR4_SPACE_TOTAL :
01063 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
01064           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_SPACE_TOTAL\n" ) ;
01065 #endif
01066           space_total = nfs_htonl64( 1024000LL ); /* Fake value */
01067           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &space_total, sizeof( fattr4_space_total ) ) ;
01068           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
01069           op_attr_success = 1 ;
01070           break ;
01071               
01072         case FATTR4_SPACE_USED:
01073 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
01074           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_SPACE_USED\n" ) ;
01075 #endif
01076           /* the number of bytes on the filesystem used by the object, which is slightly different 
01077            * from the file's size (there can be hole in the file) */
01078           file_space_used = nfs_htonl64( (fattr4_space_used)DEV_BSIZE ) ;
01079           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &file_space_used, sizeof( fattr4_space_used ) ) ;
01080           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
01081           op_attr_success = 1 ;
01082           break ;
01083               
01084         case FATTR4_SYSTEM:
01085 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
01086           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_SYSTEM\n" ) ;
01087 #endif
01088           /* This is not a windows system File-System with respect to the regarding API */
01089           system = htonl( FALSE );
01090           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &system, sizeof( fattr4_system ) ) ;
01091           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
01092           op_attr_success = 1 ;
01093           break ;
01094               
01095         case FATTR4_TIME_ACCESS:
01096 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
01097           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_TIME_ACCESS\n" ) ;
01098 #endif
01099           /* This will contain the object's time os last access, the 'atime' in the Unix semantic */
01100           memset( &(time_access.seconds), 0, sizeof( int64_t ) ) ;
01101           time_access.seconds  = nfs_htonl64( (int64_t)ServerBootTime );
01102           time_access.nseconds = htonl( 0 );
01103           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &time_access, fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ) ;
01104           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
01105           op_attr_success = 1 ;
01106           break ;
01107           
01108         case FATTR4_TIME_ACCESS_SET:
01109 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
01110           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_TIME_ACCESS_SET\n" ) ;
01111 #endif
01112           /* To be used with NFS4_OP_SETATTR only */
01113           op_attr_success = 0 ;
01114           break ;
01115          
01116       case FATTR4_TIME_BACKUP :
01117 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
01118           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_TIME_BACKUP\n" ) ;
01119 #endif
01120           /* No time backup, return unix's beginning of time */
01121           time_backup.seconds  = nfs_htonl64( 0LL ) ;
01122           time_backup.nseconds = htonl( 0 ) ;
01123           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &time_backup, fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ) ;
01124           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
01125           op_attr_success = 1 ;
01126           break ;
01127 
01128         case FATTR4_TIME_CREATE :
01129 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
01130           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_TIME_CREATE\n" ) ;
01131 #endif
01132           /* No time create, return unix's beginning of time */
01133           time_create.seconds  = nfs_htonl64( 0LL ) ;
01134           time_create.nseconds = htonl( 0 ) ;
01135           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &time_create, fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ) ;
01136           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
01137           op_attr_success = 1 ;
01138           break ;
01139           
01140         case  FATTR4_TIME_DELTA:
01141 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
01142           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_TIME_DELTA\n" ) ;
01143 #endif
01144 
01145           /* According to RFC3530, this is "the smallest usefull server time granularity", I set this to 1s */
01146           time_delta.seconds  = nfs_htonl64( 1LL );
01147           time_delta.nseconds = 0 ;
01148           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &time_delta, fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ) ;
01149           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
01150           op_attr_success = 1 ;
01151           break ;
01152           
01153         case FATTR4_TIME_METADATA :
01154 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
01155           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_TIME_METADATA\n" ) ;
01156 #endif
01157 
01158           /* The time for the last metadata operation, the ctime in the unix's semantic */
01159           memset( &(time_metadata.seconds), 0, sizeof( int64_t ) ) ;
01160           time_metadata.seconds  = nfs_htonl64( (int64_t)ServerBootTime );
01161           time_metadata.nseconds = htonl( 0 );
01162           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &time_metadata, fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ) ;
01163           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
01164           op_attr_success = 1 ;
01165           break ;
01166           
01167         case FATTR4_TIME_MODIFY :
01168 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
01169           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_TIME_MODIFY\n" ) ;
01170 #endif
01171 
01172           /* The time for the last modify operation, the mtime in the unix's semantic */
01173           memset( &(time_modify.seconds), 0, sizeof( int64_t ) ) ;
01174           time_modify.seconds  = nfs_htonl64( (int64_t)ServerBootTime );
01175           time_modify.nseconds = htonl( 0 );
01176           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset), &time_modify, fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ) ;
01177           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
01178           op_attr_success = 1 ;
01179           break ;
01180           
01181         case FATTR4_TIME_MODIFY_SET:
01182 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
01183           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_TIME_MODIFY_SET\n" ) ;
01184 #endif
01185 
01186           op_attr_success = 0 ; /* should never be used here, only for setattr */
01187           break ;
01188           
01189         case FATTR4_MOUNTED_ON_FILEID :
01190 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
01191           printf( "-----> Wanting FATTR4_MOUNTED_ON_FILEID\n" ) ;
01192 #endif
01193 
01194           mounted_on_fileid = nfs_htonl64( (fattr4_fileid)psfsp->pseudo_id );
01195           memcpy( (char *)(attrvalsBuffer + LastOffset),  &mounted_on_fileid, sizeof( fattr4_mounted_on_fileid ) ) ; 
01196           LastOffset += fattr4tab[attribute_to_set].size_fattr4 ;
01197           op_attr_success = 1 ; 
01198           break ;
01199           
01200         default:
01201           DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs, NIV_EVENT, "Bad file attributes %d queried", attribute_to_set ) ;
01202           /* BUGAZOMEU : un traitement special ici */
01203           break ;
01204         } /* switch( attr_to_set ) */ 
01205       
01206       /* Increase the Offset for the next operation if this was a success*/
01207       if( op_attr_success )
01208         {
01209           /* Set the returned bitmask */
01210           attrvalslist[j] = attribute_to_set ;
01211           j += 1 ;
01212 
01213           /* Be carefull not to get out of attrvalsBuffer */
01214           if( LastOffset > NFS4_ATTRVALS_BUFFLEN )
01215             return -1 ;
01216         }
01217 
01218       
01219       
01220     } /* for i */
01221   
01222 #ifdef   _DEBUG_NFS_V4_PSEUDO
01223           printf( "----------------------------------------\n" ) ;
01224 #endif
01225 
01226   /* LastOffset contains the length of the attrvalsBuffer usefull data */
01227   DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "Fattr (pseudo) At the end LastOffset = %u, i=%d, j=%d", LastOffset, i, j ) ;
01228 
01229   /* Set the bitmap for result */
01231   if( ( Fattr->attrmask.bitmap4_val = (uint32_t *)Mem_Alloc(  2*sizeof( uint32_t )  ) )  == NULL )
01232      return -1 ;
01233   memset( Fattr->attrmask.bitmap4_val, 0, 2*sizeof( uint32_t ) ) ;
01234 
01235   nfs4_list_to_bitmap4( &(Fattr->attrmask), &j, attrvalslist ) ;  
01236 
01237   /* Set the attrlist4 */
01238   Fattr->attr_vals.attrlist4_len = LastOffset ;
01239 
01241   if( (  Fattr->attr_vals.attrlist4_val = Mem_Alloc( Fattr->attr_vals.attrlist4_len ) ) == NULL )
01242     return -1 ;
01243   memset( Fattr->attr_vals.attrlist4_val, 0, Fattr->attr_vals.attrlist4_len ) ;
01244 
01245   memcpy( Fattr->attr_vals.attrlist4_val, attrvalsBuffer, Fattr->attr_vals.attrlist4_len );
01246   
01247   DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, 
01248                    "nfs4_PseudoToFattr (end): Fattr->attr_vals.attrlist4_len = %d", 
01249                    Fattr->attr_vals.attrlist4_len ) ;
01250   DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, 
01251                    "nfs4_PseudoToFattr (end):Fattr->attrmask.bitmap4_len = %d  [0]=%u, [1]=%u", 
01252                    Fattr->attrmask.bitmap4_len, Fattr->attrmask.bitmap4_val[0], Fattr->attrmask.bitmap4_val[1] ) ;
01253 
01254   return 0 ;
01255 } /* nfs4_PseudoToFattr*/
01256 
01257 
01258 
01259 
01271 int nfs4_FhandleToPseudo( nfs_fh4 * fh4p, pseudofs_t * psfstree, pseudofs_entry_t * psfsentry )
01272 {
01273   file_handle_v4_t * pfhandle4;
01274   
01275   /* Map the filehandle to the correct structure */
01276   pfhandle4 = (file_handle_v4_t *)(fh4p->nfs_fh4_val) ;
01277   
01278   /* The function must be called with a fh pointed to a pseudofs entry */
01279   if( pfhandle4->pseudofs_flag == FALSE )
01280     return FALSE ;
01281   
01282   /* Get the object pointer by using the reverse tab in the pseudofs structure */
01283   memcpy( psfsentry , psfstree->reverse_tab[ pfhandle4->pseudofs_id ], sizeof( pseudofs_entry_t ) ) ;
01284   
01285   return TRUE ;
01286 } /* nfs4_FhandleToPseudo */
01287 
01300 int nfs4_PseudoToFhandle( nfs_fh4 * fh4p, pseudofs_entry_t * psfsentry )
01301 {
01302   file_handle_v4_t  fhandle4 ;
01303   
01304   memset(  &fhandle4, 0, sizeof( fhandle4 ) ) ;
01305   
01306   fhandle4.pseudofs_flag = TRUE ;
01307   fhandle4.pseudofs_id = psfsentry->pseudo_id ;
01308   
01309   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "PSEUDO_TO_FH: Pseudo id = %d -> %d", psfsentry->pseudo_id, fhandle4.pseudofs_id ) ;
01310   
01311   memcpy( fh4p->nfs_fh4_val, &fhandle4, sizeof( fhandle4 ) ) ;
01312   fh4p->nfs_fh4_len = sizeof( file_handle_v4_t ) ;
01313   
01314   return TRUE ;
01315 } /* nfs4_PseudoToFhandle */
01316 
01317 
01318 
01331 int nfs4_CreateROOTFH4( nfs_fh4 * fh4p, compound_data_t * data )
01332 {
01333   pseudofs_entry_t   psfsentry ;
01334   int status = 0 ;
01335  
01336   psfsentry = * (data->pseudofs->reverse_tab[0]) ;
01337 
01338   DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "CREATE ROOTFH (pseudo): root to pseudofs = #%s#", psfsentry.name ) ;
01339  
01340   if( ( status = nfs4_AllocateFH( &(data->rootFH  ) ) ) != NFS4_OK )
01341     return status ;
01342  
01343   if( !nfs4_PseudoToFhandle( &(data->rootFH  ), &psfsentry ) )
01344     {
01345       DisplayLogLevel( NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "CREATE ROOTFH (pseudo): Creation of root fh is impossible" ) ;
01346       return NFS4ERR_BADHANDLE ;
01347     }
01348  
01349     /* Test */
01350 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFS_V4
01351   printf( "File handle = { Length = %d  Val = ", data->rootFH.nfs_fh4_len) ;
01352   for( i = 0 ; i < data->rootFH.nfs_fh4_len ; i++ )
01353     printf( "%02X", data->rootFH.nfs_fh4_val[i] );
01354   printf( " } \n" ) ;
01355 #endif
01356 
01357   return NFS4_OK ;
01358 } /* nfs4_CreateROOTFH4 */
01359 
01360 
01374 #define arg_GETATTR4 op->nfs_argop4_u.opgetattr
01375 #define res_GETATTR4 resp->nfs_resop4_u.opgetattr
01376 
01377 int nfs4_op_getattr_pseudo(  struct nfs_argop4 * op ,   
01378                              compound_data_t   * data,
01379                              struct nfs_resop4 * resp)
01380 {
01381   pseudofs_entry_t psfsentry ;
01382   char __attribute__(( __unused__ )) funcname[] = "nfs4_op_getattr" ;
01383   
01384   resp->resop = NFS4_OP_GETATTR ;
01385 
01386   /* Get the pseudo entry related to this fhandle */
01387   if( !nfs4_FhandleToPseudo( &(data->currentFH  ), data->pseudofs, &psfsentry ) )
01388     {
01389       res_GETATTR4.status = NFS4ERR_BADHANDLE ;
01390       return res_GETATTR4.status ;
01391     }
01392   
01393   
01394   /* All directories in pseudo fs have the same Fattr */
01395   if( nfs4_PseudoToFattr(   &psfsentry, 
01396                             &(res_GETATTR4.GETATTR4res_u.resok4.obj_attributes), 
01397                             data, 
01398                             &(data->currentFH),
01399                             &(arg_GETATTR4.attr_request) ) != 0 )
01400     res_GETATTR4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
01401   else
01402     res_GETATTR4.status = NFS4_OK ;
01403 
01404 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFS_V4
01405    printf( "Apres nfs4_PseudoToFattr: attrmask(bitmap4_len)=%d attrlist4_len=%d\n", 
01406            res_GETATTR4.GETATTR4res_u.resok4.obj_attributes.attrmask.bitmap4_len,
01407            res_GETATTR4.GETATTR4res_u.resok4.obj_attributes.attr_vals.attrlist4_len ) ;
01408 #endif
01409    
01410   return res_GETATTR4.status ;
01411 } /* nfs4_op_getattr */
01412 
01413 
01428 /* Shorter notation to avoid typos */
01429 #define res_ACCESS4 resp->nfs_resop4_u.opaccess
01430 #define arg_ACCESS4 op->nfs_argop4_u.opaccess
01431 
01432 int nfs4_op_access_pseudo(  struct nfs_argop4 * op ,   
01433                             compound_data_t   * data,
01434                             struct nfs_resop4 * resp)
01435 {
01436   char            __attribute__(( __unused__ )) funcname[] = "nfs4_op_access_pseudo" ;
01437   
01438   resp->resop = NFS4_OP_ACCESS ;
01439 
01440   /* All access types are supported */
01441   res_ACCESS4.ACCESS4res_u.resok4.supported = ACCESS4_READ|ACCESS4_LOOKUP ;
01442   
01443   /* DELETE/MODIFY/EXTEND are not supported in the pseudo fs */
01444   res_ACCESS4.ACCESS4res_u.resok4.access = arg_ACCESS4.access & ~(ACCESS4_MODIFY|ACCESS4_EXTEND|ACCESS4_DELETE) ;
01445  
01446   return NFS4_OK ;
01447 } /* nfs4_op_access_pseudo */
01448 
01462 /* Shorter notation to avoid typos */
01463 #define arg_LOOKUP4 op->nfs_argop4_u.oplookup
01464 #define res_LOOKUP4 resp->nfs_resop4_u.oplookup
01465 
01466 int nfs4_op_lookup_pseudo(  struct nfs_argop4 * op ,   
01467                             compound_data_t   * data,
01468                             struct nfs_resop4 * resp)
01469 {
01470   char                     name[MAXNAMLEN] ;
01471   char                     __attribute__(( __unused__ )) funcname[] = "nfs4_op_lookup_pseudo" ;
01472   pseudofs_entry_t         psfsentry ;
01473   pseudofs_entry_t       * iter = NULL ;
01474   int                      found = FALSE ;
01475   int                      error = 0 ;
01476   cache_inode_status_t     cache_status = 0 ;
01477   fsal_status_t            fsal_status ;
01478   cache_inode_fsal_data_t  fsdata ;
01479   fsal_path_t              exportpath_fsal ;
01480   fsal_attrib_list_t       attr ;
01481   fsal_handle_t            fsal_handle ;
01482 #ifdef _USE_MFSL
01483   mfsl_object_t            mobject ;
01484 #endif
01485   cache_entry_t          * pentry = NULL ;
01486   fsal_mdsize_t            strsize = MNTPATHLEN + 1 ;
01487 
01488   resp->resop = NFS4_OP_LOOKUP ;
01489 
01490   /* UTF8 strings may not end with \0, but they carry their length */
01491   strncpy( name, arg_LOOKUP4.objname.utf8string_val, arg_LOOKUP4.objname.utf8string_len ) ;
01492   name[arg_LOOKUP4.objname.utf8string_len] = '\0' ;
01493 
01494   /* Get the pseudo fs entry related to the file handle */
01495   if( !nfs4_FhandleToPseudo( &(data->currentFH  ), data->pseudofs, &psfsentry ) )
01496     {
01497       res_LOOKUP4.status = NFS4ERR_BADHANDLE ;
01498       return res_LOOKUP4.status ;
01499     }
01500   
01501   found = FALSE ;
01502   for( iter = psfsentry.sons ; iter != NULL ; iter = iter->next )
01503     {
01504       if( !strcmp( iter->name, name ) )
01505         {
01506           found = TRUE ;
01507           break ;
01508         }
01509     }
01510   
01511   if( !found )
01512     {
01513       res_LOOKUP4.status = NFS4ERR_NOENT ;
01514       return res_LOOKUP4.status ;
01515     }    
01516   
01517   /* A matching entry was found */
01518   if( iter->junction_export == NULL )
01519     {
01520       /* The entry is not a junction, we stay within the pseudo fs */
01521       if( !nfs4_PseudoToFhandle( &(data->currentFH), iter ) ) 
01522         {
01523           res_LOOKUP4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
01524           return res_LOOKUP4.status ;
01525         }
01526     }
01527   else
01528     {
01529       /* The entry is a junction */
01530       DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs, 
01531                          NIV_DEBUG, "A junction in pseudo fs is traversed: name = %s, id = %d",
01532                          iter->name, iter->junction_export->id ) ;
01533       data->pexport = iter->junction_export ;
01534       strncpy( data->MntPath, iter->fullname, NFS_MAXPATHLEN ) ;
01535       
01536       
01537       /* Build credentials */
01538       if( nfs4_MakeCred( data ) != 0 )
01539         {
01540           DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs,
01541                              NIV_MAJOR, "PSEUDO FS JUNCTION TRAVERSAL: /!\\ | Failed to get FSAL credentials for %s, id=%d",
01542                              data->pexport->fullpath, data->pexport->id ) ;
01543           res_LOOKUP4.status = NFS4ERR_WRONGSEC ;
01544           return res_LOOKUP4.status ;
01545         }
01546 
01547       /* Build fsal data for creation of the first entry */
01548       if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( ( fsal_status = FSAL_str2path( data->pexport->fullpath, strsize, &exportpath_fsal ) ) ) )
01549         {
01550           res_LOOKUP4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
01551           return res_LOOKUP4.status ;
01552         }
01553       
01554       /* Lookup the FSAL to build the fsal handle */
01555 #ifdef _USE_MFSL
01556       if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( fsal_status = MFSL_lookupPath( &exportpath_fsal, 
01557                                                         data->pcontext, 
01558                                                         &data->pclient->mfsl_context, 
01559                                                         &mobject, 
01560                                                         NULL ) ) )
01561 #else
01562       if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( fsal_status = FSAL_lookupPath( &exportpath_fsal, 
01563                                                         data->pcontext, 
01564                                                         &fsal_handle, 
01565                                                         NULL ) ) )
01566 #endif
01567         {
01568           DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs,
01569                              NIV_MAJOR, "PSEUDO FS JUNCTION TRAVERSAL: /!\\ | Failed to lookup for %s, id=%d", 
01570                              data->pexport->fullpath, data->pexport->id ) ;
01571           DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs,
01572                              NIV_MAJOR, "PSEUDO FS JUNCTION TRAVERSAL: fsal_status = ( %d, %d )", 
01573                              fsal_status.major, fsal_status.minor ) ;
01574           res_LOOKUP4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
01575           return res_LOOKUP4.status ;
01576         }
01577 
01578 #ifdef _USE_MFSL
01579       fsal_handle = mobject.handle ;
01580 #endif
01581 
01582       if( data->mounted_on_FH.nfs_fh4_len == 0 )
01583         {
01584           if( ( error =  nfs4_AllocateFH( &(data->mounted_on_FH) ) ) != NFS4_OK )
01585             {
01586               DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs,
01587                                  NIV_MAJOR, 
01588                                  "PSEUDO FS JUNCTION TRAVERSAL: /!\\ | Failed to allocate the 'mounted on' file handle" ) ;
01589               res_LOOKUP4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
01590               return res_LOOKUP4.status ;
01591             }
01592         }
01593       
01594       if( data->currentFH.nfs_fh4_len == 0 )
01595         {
01596           if( ( error =  nfs4_AllocateFH( &(data->currentFH) ) ) != NFS4_OK )
01597             {
01598               DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs,
01599                                  NIV_MAJOR, "PSEUDO FS JUNCTION TRAVERSAL: /!\\ | Failed to allocate the first file handle" ) ;
01600               res_LOOKUP4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
01601               return res_LOOKUP4.status ;
01602             }
01603         }
01604 
01605       /* Build the nfs4 handle */
01606       if( !nfs4_FSALToFhandle( &data->currentFH, &fsal_handle, data ) )
01607         {
01608           DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs,
01609                                 NIV_MAJOR, "PSEUDO FS JUNCTION TRAVERSAL: /!\\ | Failed to build the first file handle" ) ;
01610           res_LOOKUP4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
01611           return res_LOOKUP4.status ;
01612         }
01613   
01614       /* The new fh is to be the "mounted on Filehandle" */
01615       memcpy( data->mounted_on_FH.nfs_fh4_val, data->currentFH.nfs_fh4_val, sizeof( file_handle_v4_t ) ) ;
01616       data->mounted_on_FH.nfs_fh4_len = data->currentFH.nfs_fh4_len ;
01617       
01618       /* Add the entry to the cache as a root (BUGAZOMEU: make it a junction entry when junction is available) */
01619       fsdata.handle = fsal_handle ;
01620       fsdata.cookie = 0 ;
01621       if( ( pentry = cache_inode_make_root( &fsdata, 
01622                                             data->ht, 
01623                                             ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient), 
01624                                             data->pcontext,
01625                                             &cache_status ) ) == NULL )
01626         {
01627           DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs, NIV_MAJOR, 
01628                            "PSEUDO FS JUNCTION TRAVERSAL: /!\\ | Allocate root entry in cache inode failed, for %s, id=%d", 
01629                            data->pexport->fullpath, data->pexport->id ) ;
01630           res_LOOKUP4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
01631           return res_LOOKUP4.status ;
01632         }
01633 
01634       
01635       /* Get the attributes (costless: the attributes was cached when the root pentry was created */
01636       if(  cache_inode_getattr( pentry, 
01637                                 &attr, 
01638                                 data->ht,
01639                                 ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient), 
01640                                 data->pcontext,
01641                                 &cache_status ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
01642         {
01643           DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs,
01644                                 NIV_MAJOR, "PSEUDO FS JUNCTION TRAVERSAL: /!\\ | Failed to get attributes for root pentry" );
01645           res_LOOKUP4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
01646           return res_LOOKUP4.status ;
01647         }
01648 
01649       /* Keep the pentry within the compound data */
01650       data->current_entry = pentry ;
01651       data->current_filetype = cache_inode_fsal_type_convert( attr.type ) ;
01652       
01653     } /* else */
01654   
01655   
01656   res_LOOKUP4.status = NFS4_OK ;
01657   return NFS4_OK ;
01658 } /* nfs4_op_lookup_pseudo */
01659 
01660 
01661 
01675 /* Shorter notation to avoid typos */
01676 #define arg_LOOKUPP4 op->nfs_argop4_u.oplookupp
01677 #define res_LOOKUPP4 resp->nfs_resop4_u.oplookupp
01678 
01679 
01680 int nfs4_op_lookupp_pseudo(  struct nfs_argop4 * op ,   
01681                              compound_data_t   * data,
01682                              struct nfs_resop4 * resp)
01683 {
01684   char               __attribute__(( __unused__ )) funcname[] = "nfs4_op_lookup_pseudo" ;
01685   pseudofs_entry_t   psfsentry ;
01686 
01687   resp->resop = NFS4_OP_LOOKUPP ;
01688 
01689     
01690   /* Get the pseudo fs entry related to the file handle */
01691   if( !nfs4_FhandleToPseudo( &(data->currentFH), data->pseudofs, &psfsentry ) )
01692     {
01693       res_LOOKUPP4.status = NFS4ERR_BADHANDLE ;
01694       return res_LOOKUPP4.status ;
01695     }
01696 
01697   /* A matching entry was found */
01698   if( !nfs4_PseudoToFhandle( &(data->currentFH), psfsentry.parent ) ) 
01699     {
01700       res_LOOKUPP4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
01701       return res_LOOKUPP4.status ;
01702     }
01703 
01704   
01705   /* Copy this to the mounted on FH (if no junction is traversed */
01706   memcpy( (char *)(data->mounted_on_FH.nfs_fh4_val), 
01707           (char *)(data->currentFH.nfs_fh4_val), data->currentFH.nfs_fh4_len ) ;
01708   data->mounted_on_FH.nfs_fh4_len = data->currentFH.nfs_fh4_len ;
01709   
01710   /* Keep the vnode pointer within the data compound */
01711   data->current_entry = NULL ;
01712   data->current_filetype = UNASSIGNED ;
01713 
01714   res_LOOKUPP4.status  = NFS4_OK ;
01715   return NFS4_OK ;
01716 } /* nfs4_op_lookupp_pseudo */
01717 
01718 
01719 
01733 /* shorter notation to avoid typo */
01734 #define arg_READDIR4 op->nfs_argop4_u.opreaddir
01735 #define res_READDIR4 resp->nfs_resop4_u.opreaddir
01736 
01737 int nfs4_op_readdir_pseudo( struct nfs_argop4 * op ,   
01738                             compound_data_t   * data,
01739                             struct nfs_resop4 * resp)
01740 {
01741   unsigned long              dircount = 0 ; 
01742   unsigned long              maxcount = 0 ;
01743   unsigned long              estimated_num_entries = 0 ;
01744   unsigned long              i = 0 ;
01745   nfs_cookie4                cookie ;
01746   verifier4                  cookie_verifier;
01747   unsigned long              space_used = 0 ;
01748   pseudofs_entry_t           psfsentry ;
01749   pseudofs_entry_t *         iter = NULL ;
01750   entry4 *                   entry_nfs_array = NULL ;
01751   entry_name_array_item_t  * entry_name_array = NULL ;
01752   nfs_fh4                    entryFH ;
01753   cache_inode_fsal_data_t    fsdata ;
01754   fsal_path_t                exportpath_fsal ;
01755   fsal_attrib_list_t         attr ;
01756   fsal_handle_t              fsal_handle ;
01757 #ifdef _USE_MFSL
01758   mfsl_object_t              mobject ;
01759 #endif 
01760   fsal_mdsize_t              strsize = MNTPATHLEN + 1 ;
01761   fsal_status_t              fsal_status ;
01762   int                        error = 0 ;
01763   cache_inode_status_t       cache_status = CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS  ;
01764   cache_entry_t           *  pentry = NULL ;
01765 
01766   char                       __attribute__(( __unused__ )) funcname[] = "nfs4_op_readdir_pseudo" ;
01767     
01768   bitmap4   RdAttrErrorBitmap = { 1, (uint32_t *)"\0\0\0\b" } ; /* 0xB = 11 = FATTR4_RDATTR_ERROR */
01769   attrlist4 RdAttrErrorVals   = { 0, NULL } ;                   /* Nothing to be seen here */
01770 
01771   resp->resop = NFS4_OP_READDIR ;
01772   res_READDIR4.status =  NFS4_OK  ;
01773 
01774   entryFH.nfs_fh4_len = 0 ;
01775   
01776   DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "Entering NFS4_OP_READDIR_PSEUDO" ) ;
01777 
01778   /* get the caracteristic value for readdir operation */
01779   dircount = arg_READDIR4.dircount ;
01780   maxcount = arg_READDIR4.maxcount ;
01781   cookie   = arg_READDIR4.cookie ;
01782   space_used = sizeof( entry4 ) ;
01783 
01784   /* dircount is considered meaningless by many nfsv4 client (like the CITI one). we use maxcount instead */
01785   estimated_num_entries = maxcount / sizeof( entry4 )  ;
01786   
01787   DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs, 
01788                         NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "PSEUDOFS READDIR: dircount=%d, maxcount=%d, cookie=%d, sizeof(entry4)=%d num_entries=%d",
01789                    dircount, maxcount, cookie, space_used, estimated_num_entries ) ;
01790   
01791   /* If maxcount is too short, return NFS4ERR_TOOSMALL */
01792   if( maxcount < sizeof( entry4 ) || estimated_num_entries == 0  )
01793     {
01794       res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_TOOSMALL ;
01795       return res_READDIR4.status ;
01796     }
01797 
01798   /* Now resolve the file handle to pseudo fs */
01799   if( !nfs4_FhandleToPseudo( &(data->currentFH  ), data->pseudofs, &psfsentry ) )
01800     {
01801       res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_BADHANDLE ;
01802       return res_READDIR4.status ;
01803     }
01804   DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "PSEUDOFS READDIR in #%s#", psfsentry.name ) ;
01805   
01806   /* If this a junction filehandle ? */
01807   if( psfsentry.junction_export != NULL )
01808     {
01809       /* This is a junction */
01810       DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs, 
01811                          NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "PSEUDOFS READDIR : DIR #%s# id=%u is a junction\n", 
01812                          psfsentry.name, psfsentry.junction_export->id ) ;
01813 
01814       /* Step up the compound data */
01815       data->pexport = psfsentry.junction_export ;
01816       strncpy( data->MntPath, psfsentry.fullname, NFS_MAXPATHLEN ) ;
01817       
01818       /* Build the credentials */
01819       if( nfs4_MakeCred( data ) != 0 )
01820         {
01821           DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs,
01822                              NIV_MAJOR, "PSEUDO FS JUNCTION TRAVERSAL: /!\\ | Failed to get FSAL credentials for %s, id=%d",
01823                              data->pexport->fullpath, data->pexport->id ) ;
01824           res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_WRONGSEC ;
01825           return res_READDIR4.status ;
01826         }
01827       /* Build fsal data for creation of the first entry */
01828       if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( ( fsal_status = FSAL_str2path( data->pexport->fullpath, strsize, &exportpath_fsal ) ) ) )
01829         {
01830           res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
01831           return res_READDIR4.status ;
01832         }
01833       
01834       /* Lookup the FSAL to build the fsal handle */
01835 #ifdef _USE_MFSL
01836       if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( fsal_status = MFSL_lookupPath( &exportpath_fsal, 
01837                                                         data->pcontext, 
01838                                                         &data->pclient->mfsl_context,
01839                                                         &mobject, 
01840                                                         NULL ) ) )
01841 #else
01842       if( FSAL_IS_ERROR( fsal_status = FSAL_lookupPath( &exportpath_fsal, 
01843                                                         data->pcontext, 
01844                                                         &fsal_handle, 
01845                                                         NULL ) ) )
01846 #endif
01847         {
01848           DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs,
01849                              NIV_MAJOR, "PSEUDO FS JUNCTION TRAVERSAL: /!\\ | Failed to lookup for %s, id=%d", 
01850                              data->pexport->fullpath, data->pexport->id ) ;
01851           DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs, NIV_MAJOR, "PSEUDO FS JUNCTION TRAVERSAL: fsal_status = ( %d, %d )", 
01852                              fsal_status.major, fsal_status.minor ) ;
01853           res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
01854           return res_READDIR4.status ;
01855         }
01856 
01857 #ifdef _USE_MFSL
01858       fsal_handle = mobject.handle ;
01859 #endif
01860 
01861       if( data->mounted_on_FH.nfs_fh4_len == 0 )
01862         {
01863           if( ( error =  nfs4_AllocateFH( &(data->mounted_on_FH) ) ) != NFS4_OK )
01864             {
01865               DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs,
01866                                  NIV_MAJOR, "PSEUDO FS JUNCTION TRAVERSAL: /!\\ | Failed to allocate the 'mounted on' file handle" ) ;
01867               res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
01868               return res_READDIR4.status ;
01869             }
01870         }
01871       
01872       if( data->currentFH.nfs_fh4_len == 0 )
01873         {
01874           if( ( error =  nfs4_AllocateFH( &(data->currentFH) ) ) != NFS4_OK )
01875             {
01876               DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs,
01877                                  NIV_MAJOR, "PSEUDO FS JUNCTION TRAVERSAL: /!\\ | Failed to allocate the first file handle" ) ;
01878               res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
01879               return res_READDIR4.status ;
01880             }
01881         }
01882 
01883       /* Build the nfs4 handle */
01884       if( !nfs4_FSALToFhandle( &data->currentFH, &fsal_handle, data ) )
01885         {
01886           DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs,
01887                              NIV_MAJOR, "PSEUDO FS JUNCTION TRAVERSAL: /!\\ | Failed to build the first file handle" ) ;
01888           res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
01889           return res_READDIR4.status ;
01890         }
01891   
01892       /* The new fh is to be the "mounted on Filehandle" */
01893       memcpy( data->mounted_on_FH.nfs_fh4_val, data->currentFH.nfs_fh4_val, sizeof( file_handle_v4_t ) ) ;
01894       data->mounted_on_FH.nfs_fh4_len = data->currentFH.nfs_fh4_len ;
01895       
01896       /* Add the entry to the cache as a root (BUGAZOMEU: make it a junction entry when junction is available) */
01897       fsdata.handle = fsal_handle ;
01898       fsdata.cookie = 0 ;
01899       if( ( pentry = cache_inode_make_root( &fsdata, 
01900                                             data->ht, 
01901                                             ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient), 
01902                                             data->pcontext,
01903                                             &cache_status ) ) == NULL )
01904         {
01905           DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs, NIV_MAJOR, 
01906                            "PSEUDO FS JUNCTION TRAVERSAL: /!\\ | Allocate root entry in cache inode failed, for %s, id=%d", 
01907                            data->pexport->fullpath, data->pexport->id ) ;
01908           res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
01909           return res_READDIR4.status ;
01910         }
01911 
01912       
01913       /* Get the attributes (costless: the attributes was cached when the root pentry was created */
01914       if(  cache_inode_getattr( pentry, 
01915                                 &attr, 
01916                                 data->ht,
01917                                 ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient), 
01918                                 data->pcontext,
01919                                 &cache_status ) != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
01920         {
01921           DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs,
01922                              NIV_MAJOR, "PSEUDO FS JUNCTION TRAVERSAL: /!\\ | Failed to get attributes for root pentry" );
01923           res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
01924           return res_READDIR4.status ;
01925         }
01926 
01927       /* Keep the pentry within the compound data */
01928       data->current_entry = pentry ;
01929       data->current_filetype = cache_inode_fsal_type_convert( attr.type ) ;
01930 
01931 
01932       /* redo the call on the other side of the junction */
01933       return nfs4_op_readdir( op, data, resp ) ;
01934     }
01935 
01936   /* Allocation of the entries array */
01937   if( ( entry_name_array = (entry_name_array_item_t *)Mem_Alloc( estimated_num_entries * (FSAL_MAX_NAME_LEN + 1) ) ) == NULL )
01938     {
01939        DisplayErrorLog( ERR_SYS, ERR_MALLOC, errno ) ;
01940        res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
01941        return res_READDIR4.status;
01942     }
01943   memset( (char *)entry_name_array, 0, estimated_num_entries * (FSAL_MAX_NAME_LEN + 1) ) ;
01944 
01945   if( ( entry_nfs_array = (entry4 *)Mem_Alloc( estimated_num_entries * sizeof( entry4 ) ) ) == NULL )
01946     {
01947       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_SYS, ERR_MALLOC, errno ) ;
01948       res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
01949       return res_READDIR4.status;
01950     }
01951 
01952   /* Cookie verifier has the value of the Server Boot Time for pseudo fs */
01953 #ifdef _WITH_COOKIE_VERIFIER
01954   /* BUGAZOMEU: management of the cookie verifier */
01955   memset(cookie_verifier, 0, NFS4_VERIFIER_SIZE ) ;
01956   if( NFS_SpecificConfig.UseCookieVerf == 1 )
01957     {
01958       memcpy(cookie_verifier, &ServerBootTime, sizeof( ServerBootTime) );
01959       if( cookie !=0  )
01960         {
01961           if(  memcmp(cookie_verifier, arg_READDIR4.cookieverf, NFS4_VERIFIER_SIZE  ) != 0 )
01962             {
01963               res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_BAD_COOKIE ;
01964               Mem_Free( entry_nfs_array ) ;
01965               return  res_READDIR4.status ;
01966             }    
01967         }
01968     }
01969 #endif
01970   /* Cookie delivered by the server and used by the client SHOULD not ne 0, 1 or 2 (cf RFC3530, page192)
01971    * because theses value are reserved for special use.
01972    *      0 - cookie for first READDIR
01973    *      1 - reserved for . on client handside
01974    *      2 - reserved for .. on client handside
01975    * Entries '.' and '..' are not returned also
01976    * For these reason, there will be an offset of 3 between NFS4 cookie and HPSS cookie */
01977   
01978   /* make sure to start at the right position given by the cookie */
01979   iter = psfsentry.sons ;
01980   if( cookie != 0 )
01981     {
01982       for( ; iter != NULL ; iter = iter->next )
01983         if( ( iter->pseudo_id + 3 ) == cookie )
01984           break ;
01985     }
01986   
01987   /* Here, where are sure that iter is set to the position indicated eventually by the cookie */
01988   i = 0 ;
01989   for( ; iter != NULL ; iter = iter->next )
01990     {
01991       DisplayLogJdLevel( ((cache_inode_client_t *)data->pclient)->log_outputs, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "PSEUDO FS: Found entry %s", iter->name ) ;
01992       
01993       entry_nfs_array[i].name.utf8string_len = strlen( iter->name ) ;
01994       strncpy( entry_name_array[i], iter->name, FSAL_MAX_NAME_LEN) ;
01995 
01996       entry_nfs_array[i].name.utf8string_val =  entry_name_array[i] ;
01997       entry_nfs_array[i].cookie = iter->pseudo_id + 3 ;
01998 
01999       /* If file handle is asked in the attributes, provide it */
02000       if( arg_READDIR4.attr_request.bitmap4_val[0] & FATTR4_FILEHANDLE )
02001         {
02002           if( entryFH.nfs_fh4_len == 0 )
02003             {
02004               if( nfs4_AllocateFH( &entryFH ) != NFS4_OK )
02005                 {
02006                   return res_READDIR4.status ;
02007                 }
02008             }
02009           
02010           if( !nfs4_PseudoToFhandle( &entryFH, iter ) )
02011             {
02012               res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
02013               Mem_Free( entry_nfs_array ) ;
02014               return res_READDIR4.status ;
02015             }
02016         }
02017 
02018       if( nfs4_PseudoToFattr( iter,
02019                               &(entry_nfs_array[i].attrs), 
02020                               data, 
02021                               &entryFH,
02022                               &(arg_READDIR4.attr_request) ) != 0 )
02023         {
02024           /* Should never occured, but the is no reason for leaving the section without any information */
02025           entry_nfs_array[i].attrs.attrmask  = RdAttrErrorBitmap ;
02026           entry_nfs_array[i].attrs.attr_vals = RdAttrErrorVals ;
02027         }
02028   
02029       /* Chain the entry together */
02030       entry_nfs_array[i].nextentry = NULL;
02031       if( i != 0 )
02032         entry_nfs_array[i-1].nextentry = &(entry_nfs_array[i]);
02033     
02034       /* Increment the counter */
02035       i += 1 ;
02036       
02037       /* Did we reach the maximum number of entries */
02038       if( i == estimated_num_entries )
02039         break ;
02040     }
02041 
02042   /* Resize entry_nfs_array */
02043   /* @todo : Is this reallocation actually needed ? */
02044 #ifdef BUGAZOMEU
02045   if( i < estimated_num_entries )
02046     if( ( entry_nfs_array = Mem_Realloc( entry_nfs_array, i * sizeof( entry4 ) ) ) == NULL )
02047       {
02048       DisplayErrorLog( ERR_SYS, ERR_MALLOC, errno ) ;
02049       res_READDIR4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
02050       Mem_Free( entry_nfs_array ) ;
02051       return res_READDIR4.status;
02052     }
02053 #endif
02054   /* Build the reply */
02055   memcpy( res_READDIR4.READDIR4res_u.resok4.cookieverf, cookie_verifier, NFS4_VERIFIER_SIZE ) ;
02056   if( i == 0 )
02057     res_READDIR4.READDIR4res_u.resok4.reply.entries = NULL ;
02058   else
02059     res_READDIR4.READDIR4res_u.resok4.reply.entries = entry_nfs_array ;
02060 
02061   /* did we reach the end ? */
02062   if( iter == NULL )
02063     {
02064       /* Yes, we did */
02065       res_READDIR4.READDIR4res_u.resok4.reply.eof = TRUE ;
02066     }
02067   else
02068     {
02069       /* No, there are some more entries */
02070       res_READDIR4.READDIR4res_u.resok4.reply.eof = FALSE ;
02071     }
02072   
02073   /* Exit properly */
02074   res_READDIR4.status = NFS4_OK ; 
02075   
02076   return NFS4_OK ;
02077 } /* nfs4_op_readdir_pseudo */
Generated on Tue Mar 31 14:37:44 2009 for NFS and Mount protocols layer by  1.5.7.1
